intro: Malacocarpus apricus, commonly known as the yellow pisonia, is a tropical shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves that are elliptical in shape. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Malacocarpus apricus is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils.
